overall_summary: The reasoning trajectory demonstrates a methodical approach to forecasting hourly time-series data with limited historical points (96 hours). The analyst identifies daily seasonality and handles outliers through robust statistical methods, ultimately selecting a median-based pattern repetition due to data constraints. The approach prioritizes simplicity and robustness over complex modeling given the short data horizon.
common_data_patterns: No missing values in provided data
key_insights: Median aggregation preferred over mean to mitigate outlier impact
Explicit handling of anomalies (e.g., -13.432 value) through robust statistics
Pattern repetition justified by strong daily seasonality
Trade-off between model complexity (SARIMA/ETS) and data limitations acknowledged
Temporal alignment maintained for hourly forecasts across 4-day horizon
complexity_analysis: Moderately complex: Combines data diagnostics, method evaluation, and statistical computations with clear justifications for simplicity trade-offs, though avoids advanced modeling due to data constraints.
